title: Hextech Repair Tool Problem In Mac
body:
I downloaded the hextech repair tool, but when I opened it, the windows is too far up and is off screen, so I can't use it. I've tried moving it to no success.

https://gyazo.com/4777936f7080c896f54e80a82a15e6a1

replies.body:
Solved this problem by using Apple's "Script Editor" which you can find in /Applications/Utilities/.

1. Open the Script Editor.
2. Create a new script (cmd + N).
3. Copy/paste this:

tell application "System Events"
	set position of first window of application process "HextechRepairTool" to {100, 100}
end tell

4. Run the script (cmd + R)
5. Done!

Hope this works for you.

Thanks for your suggestion, just to add to the solution for some people who this might not have worked for:

When I first tried it was returning with an error saying: 'System Events got an error: Access for assistive devices is disabled.'

To resolve this, go to system preferences>accessibility and checl 'Enable assistive devices'
Thank you so much!

Hey ! I'm uping this maybe a couple of months too late but I just had the same issue and I found an answer by my own. 
So, I don't know if it is the same for you but i used to hide the toolbar on my MacBook, so it just appears when I put my mouse on the top of the screen. I finally realized (after some long hours) that I had to open the HTR (it opens too high) then go in system settings > general > then uncheck the set that hide the toolbar, and the HTR automatically comes down !

For me, OSX 10.8.5. I was trying to fix an issue where I was disconnected from chat permanently, and every time I load up a game (using customs or the practice tool so I don't mess people's games up!) I get a black screen and a message saying that it can't connect. All my non-League internet has been fine though.

You seem to be having a network problem reaching our game servers, further affirmed by the black screen which results from failing to download assets.  You'll want to go over each step of the [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) guide to fix it up.  I hope that helps!
